column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////In terms of pastries
column2: the croissants are definitely the star for me. Common Bond manages to make them look fragile yet structured (if that makes sense)--they're baked a bold golden brown color and are giant proportions. Yet when you slice into one
column3: it crackles easily and the inside is actually quite hollow. There are layers of crispy shell encasing the fluffier
column4: lighter layers. I prefer the pain au chocolat over the almond croissant
column5: but there needs to be more filling in general. Some chocolate was tucked into my croissant
column6: but not enough to be satisfied. I'd say it was about 30% chocolate.
